title: 115_hr4173
content: The "Veterans Crisis Line Study Act of 2017" is a study on the efficacy of the Veterans Crisis Line. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will conduct a study on the outcomes and efficacy of the Veterans Crisis Line over a 5-year period starting in 2014. The study will analyze national suicide data and data from the Veterans Crisis Line to determine the effectiveness of leading veterans to sustained mental health care. The study will analyze the outcomes and efficacy of the Veterans Crisis Line over a 5-year period, focusing on the visibility and role of the Crisis Line in providing mental health care services to veterans. The study will analyze the effectiveness of the Veterans Crisis Line in assisting veterans at risk for suicide, specifically looking at the number of veterans under the care of a mental health provider who contact the Crisis Line and the impact of receiving sustained mental health care on suicidality. The effectiveness of the Veterans Crisis Line in preventing suicides among veterans is evaluated by analyzing the number of contacts and the support provided to non-veterans seeking help for veterans. This includes determining the number of veterans who contact the Crisis Line and later commit or attempt suicide, as well as the frequency of their contacts before such incidents occur. The efficacy of the Veterans Crisis Line in preventing repeated suicide attempts among veterans is evaluated by analyzing the long-term impact and referral to mental health care. This includes determining the number of veterans who contacted the Crisis Line and later committed or attempted suicide, as well as the effect of mental health care referral on suicide risk. The Veterans Crisis Line's efficacy in preventing suicide attempts among veterans is evaluated by analyzing the impact on mental health care referral. The Secretary is required to submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs by May 31, 2019, including data on veterans who contacted the Crisis Line and did not attempt suicide soon after. The term "Veterans Crisis Line" refers to the toll-free hotline for veterans established under section 1720F(h) of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary is required to submit a study to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the efficacy of the Veterans Crisis Line in preventing suicide attempts among veterans. Passed the House of Representatives on November 8, 2017. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
